oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oral history interview with Dr. Frank F. Drowota, Jr., 1980 November 20, excerpt 04
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville minister Dr. Frank F. Drowota, Jr., conducted on 20 November 1980 by Helen Drowota as part of the Century III Nashville: Nashville Heritage Project. Drowota, a native of England and the founding minister of Nashville's Woodmont Christian Church, discusses coming to Nashville during World War II and the area and businesses around Woodmont Christian Church at the time. He also discusses the city limits at the time and the growth of the suburbs after World War II. The complete interview, as well as an index, is available in the repository.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Drowota, Frank F., 1904-1998--Interviews
